author: gszy
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

1. `debootstrap` a Debian Stretch container (`--variant=minbase`);
2. start it with `systemd-nspawn`;
3. disable installing _recommended_ and _suggested_ packages:
    ```bash
    echo 'APT::Install-Suggests "0";' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/04norecommends
    echo 'APT::Install-Recommends "0";' >> /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/04norecommends
    ```
4. install `apt-transport-https`, `ca-certificates`, `curl`, `dbus`, `gnupg` and `systemd`;
5. install PowerShell following the [official instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/powershell/scripting/setup/installing-powershell-core-on-linux?view=powershell-6#debian-9);
6. remove `curl` and `gnupg`;
7. run `pwsh`.

Expected behavior
-----------------

PowerShell should be started.

Actual behavior
---------------

> Failed to initialize CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x8007001F

Last lines from `strace`:

> fcntl(0, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, 0)            = 5
> fcntl(1, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, 0)            = 6
> fcntl(2, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, 0)            = 7
> open("/sys/devices/system/cpu/online", O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC) = 8
> read(8, "0-3\n", 8192)                  = 4
> close(8)                                = 0
> gettid()                                = 8362
> mlock(0x7fec73965000, 4096)             = -1 EPERM (Operation not permitted)
> write(2, "Failed to initialize CoreCLR, HR"..., 49Failed to initialize CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x8007001F) = 49
> write(2, "\n", 1
> )                       = 1
> munmap(0x7fec73967000, 2922376)         = 0
> munmap(0x7fec73c31000, 2803352)         = 0
> rt_sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, ~[RTMIN RT_1], [], 8) = 0
> rt_sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, [], NULL, 8) = 0

(these two lines get repeated 19 more times)

> exit_group(-2147450743)                 = ?
> +++ exited with 137 +++

comments.author: gszy
comments.body:
Well, this is the relevant error message:

> mlock(0x7fec73965000, 4096) = -1 EPERM (Operation not permitted)

From https://github.com/dotnet/source-build/issues/285#issuecomment-399949984:

> CoreCLR uses `mlock` during VM startup. CoreCLR wont run without it. And the build needs to use CoreCLR to run msbuild. You need to somehow give your chroot permission to use `mlock` (`CAP_IPC_LOCK`).
>
> Are you using `systemd-nspawn` by any chance? `--capability=CAP_IPC_LOCK` should work for that case.

See also https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/issues/18634.

Thanks, @omajid!

title: Cannot run inside Debian­‑based systemd-nspawn container
